channel.title: Trying to help
channel.description: I have realized that not a lot of people actually know what they are doing on here (I am not saying everyone, but there are a lot), and I would like to help. I would like to start creating some lessons like how to create Hello World, explaining syntax, arrays, data structures, ect... I wan't to do it with an easy to learn sub language since I know that it helped understand other programming languages and was an important stepping stone. The language I would like to use is GML. I know its not the best language in the world, but it is also not the worst with the right extensions and knowledge. I would begin right away on these lessons so please vote above to let me know if I should.

item.title: Trying to help
item.dc:creator: @n-Development n-Development
item.description:
@n-Development wrote:

Not really following you. I wish to each others how to program, the language is not really of importance. I know its an easy language to interpret and is a doorway to better more powerful languages.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to help
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I think you’re just trying to make a name for yourself, by acting ‘edgy’ or ‘determined’, when really youre not the first person, nor the last to try this. Just like GML Programmer (who felt the same level of superiority, by using an inferior language… its like you could be twins)

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to help
item.dc:creator: @n-Development n-Development
item.description:
@n-Development wrote:

[quote=“dain bramage, post:13, topic:443063”][quote author=n-Development link=topic=545753.msg4000749#msg4000749 date=1337959049]
GML is a great doorway for any language. Especially c/c#/c++.
[/quote]
Read what _s said again. Even if you did release a set of tutorials for GML, they probably wouldn’t be embraced by this (majorly Java based) community. By the way, Java and C# are basically the same :P.[/quote]

I’d like to try either way. I know it may not be embraced, but I can try.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to help
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

n-Development:

GML is a great doorway for any language. Especially c/c#/c++.

Read what _s said again. Even if you did release a set of tutorials for GML, it probably wouldn’t be embraced by this (majorly Java based) community. By the way, Java and C# are basically the same :P.

item.title: Trying to help
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

no, GML is not a good teaching language and the vast majority of people on this forum would rather learn java, which has plenty of resources for learning anyway. you’d probably be wasting your time.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to help
item.dc:creator: @n-Development n-Development
item.description:
@n-Development wrote:

Give my lessons a chance. Look at my syntax and programming methods. Then you can decide whether or not I should continue. I’ll release v1 by next week.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to help
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

There’s a reason why there aren’t many tutorials (on here and on MITB). People are often incorrect and may teach bad programming habits to other people.

Read full topic

item.description:
@n-Development wrote:

To those who do wan’t help learning how to program, I will be creating a pack of tutorials and then once it is finished I will release it. I’m not exactly sure where though. I guess once it is complete I will create I new topic on the general programming section so be on the lookout.
